snippet: The Navy can build a $100 million submarine training range off the coast of Southern Georgia and Northern Florida, a federal judge ruled Monday.
abstract: Judge Lisa Wood rules that the United States Navy can build a $100 million submarine training range off the coast of southern Georgia and northern Florida, dismissing a lawsuit by environmental groups claiming the project would harm the endangered North Atlantic right whale.
lead_paragraph: The Navy can build a $100 million submarine training range off the coast of Southern Georgia and Northern Florida, a federal judge ruled Monday.

headline.main: Georgia: Suit Dismissed Over Submarine Training
headline.print_headline: Georgia: Suit Dismissed Over Submarine Training
